website_summaries.verdict: These inserts have a gusseted center for a snug fit around the legs and fewer leaks. They also come with 100 bamboo disposable liners, delivering great value for money.
pros: A five-layered construction with plush bamboo charcoal fleece on the outside and three inner layers of microfiber keep little ones comfortable and dry
Comes with bamboo liners to help reduce staining
cons: Edges can begin to fray over time, but this doesn't affect absorbency

customer_reviews.title: Soaks up A LOT of pee.
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I know these are baby diaper liners, but hear me out. I got walking pneumonia and was coughing all day long... So after just having a baby and all, well.. Let me just say that I never had any wet spots. These pads saved me money and worked better than disposable all nighters!
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Love the color- does not show stains
customer_reviews.text: A+ for absorbency and the ease of use. Love the color- does not show stains. Does not retain odors. So far we have been using these for 4 months straight- did not need to strip them yet and they work very well. We stopped using Grovia inserts as well as cotton prefolds and bamboo prefolds because these are our favorite. For us, they work with Grivia, Flips, Ramperoos and Thirsties covers. The best we found so far.
customer_reviews.author: MB in Minneapolis

customer_reviews.title: Great for heavy wetters
customer_reviews.text: These worked great for our heavy wetter. Plan to save them for our next kiddo. They wash well (make sure to soak them in hot, and I mean hot, water before the first wash. The water is so gross from the manufacturing process lol). Love the fact they are stretchy in the middle so they fold well with the diaper. I wish they were just a tad bit longer but as long as you hold them in the front when you first put them back in and fold them it works well.
customer_reviews.author: LadiNightshade

customer_reviews.title: Happy with inserts
customer_reviews.text: These have held up throughout the 8 Months my child has been clothed diapered. For us, they are much easier to insert than the MF or hemp inserts we have and have held very well with our heavy wetter. The seams have not come undone as other reviews have stated. We wash on the 3rd day and have never had to strip these. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: K. Green

customer_reviews.title: Soooo absorbent!!!
customer_reviews.text: These I can leave on my heavy weatter for the whole night( 7-10hrs)!! They don't leak!!! I use them with flip cover.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Baby approved
customer_reviews.text: I love that these have gussets, I use them as am insert for a diaper cover rather than using prefolds. I've also used these as a doubler for overnight and I have no complaints about them. They're wonderful and soft. My baby would cry through every diaper change in disposables...and anytime she was wet or dirty. She seemed so uncomfortable. As soon as we switched to cloth I noticed a difference. She really seems to like when I use these inserts in a diaper cover. I have yet to experience a leak with these.
customer_reviews.author: working mom

customer_reviews.title: Turned my entire stash blue/grey
customer_reviews.text: I washed with cold water and the colors bled; my entire stash, covers and inserts, are a grungy blue/grey now. Washing separately doesn’t work for me so I don’t plan on using these. Edit: adjusting my rating because they warn you not to wash these with covers or clothing. Don’t make the same mistake!
customer_reviews.author: mj

customer_reviews.title: Worth it - sub out for your current liners!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: odor reducing, zero stains, washes up easily, super sturdy, very absorbent but NOT bulky, excellent form (gathered in middle), fits ALL our cloth diaper outers. We love them so much we replaced all our liners with these. Easy to insert. Makes outers fit more snugly around the crotch/leg danger zone because it’s gathered in that area ergonomically. On month 4 and no accumulation of nasty smells; washes up great. Cons: because they are grey, you can see them inside some lighter diaper outer shells. We have to run them 1.5x through the dryer on gentle to make sure they get totally dry. Net net: worth the extra expense to replace your liners with these. No more doubling up liners.
customer_reviews.author: lo_fer

customer_reviews.title: Elastic Breaks!!!
customer_reviews.text: Washed them twice and the elastic broke on one side! Five of them in the package did this. Tried to exchange them for new ones but they wouldn't process the exchange!
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I've cloth diapered through two children faithfully. Following the birth of my second, I received a TON of Alva baby diapers as a gift. The prints were adorable and the diapers were soft, but the pocket inserts that they come with are unfortunately not very absorbant. Far from my favorites. We purchased these and they were the perfect solution! They're incredibly absorbant and super soft. They've been in use now close to a year and they don't hold onto any odors with proper care, and they're still soft as ever. HIGHLY recommend, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about 4 months
customer_reviews.text: My wife an I purchased several sets of these to go in our son's cloth diapers as the inserts that came with them were needing to be stripped after only 2 months of use. We had hoped these would not have that issue at all or atleast as quickly. Sadly these made it to 6 months(4 months of use), before needing to be stripped as well and my wife tells me you can't do it to these because of the material (bamboo). As they are being used by 1 child I wouldn't have expected such a bad leaking problem with what, in my opinion, is not heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.text: I was new to cloth diapering when I bought these but wanted a couple of options and these became my favorite daytime diaper for my LO. The gussets are amazing, plus these clean very well in my HE washer. I use Charlie's soap now but used Borax before it was difficult to find during the pandemic. I use bamboo liners to catch solids and Thirsty's diaper covers. Super absorbant, these have never let me down. No leaks, no blowouts. I could see them used with pocket diapers, though that's not how I use them. I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Dria94

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Insert
customer_reviews.text: After being tortured with leaks from cheap microfiber, these were a breath of fresh air. Definitely very rare for our son to leak during the day. We're still working on a nightime solution because these inserts are pretty thick. It's hard to add extra without running into sleeping position issues. However, I'm not complaining! We've had many leak free nights as well.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah B.

customer_reviews.title: Love these! Wish I had them sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Hello, I’m Jennifer and I purchased these on a family members account. These inserts are some of the best I’ve ever used and I’ve been cloth diapering my boys since 2015. The gusset is so great and helps to prevent side leaks and well as helps keep the diaper fitted to my baby’s legs as he goes about his day. I also have them in the white shade and those work just as well. I will definitely be recommending these to other cloth diapering parents.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Genard

customer_reviews.title: So great, I'm writing a review!
customer_reviews.text: Work great! Worth the money. We have a going on 6 month old and we just bought a second set so we can stop using the ones that came with the diapers. We have a basket full of inserts including Bum Genius, but they are worthless compared to these. I don't even know why they come with inserts that are so inferior. Do yourself a favor and get a set of good inserts and you'll know what I mean. Just make sure you wash and dry them 5 or 6 times before you start using them.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith R Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: they hold a lot of urine and I happy for that cause I have had zero urine leaks ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this with the grovia shells, they hold a lot of urine and I happy for that cause I have had zero urine leaks since using it. However, because my baby is a breastfed only baby so far, her poops tend to leak unto the shell, so I sometimes have to change shell when I am changing this insert as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jasyl

customer_reviews.title: best baby purchase!
customer_reviews.text: The gussets in these inserts catch the poo much better, I was actually able to use the same cover for a couple days because these worked so well at not only catching solid waste, but absorbing urine. My little ones bottom is dry even when the insert is soaked! Love, love, love these! *Update* bought a second set of these, and they have changed them, one of them broke in the first wash, they are thinner and too long for my diapers. *second update* contacted seller, very helpful, prompt response and great customer service. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Drew Martens

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: These are a cloth diapering game changer. We were about to give up, as the other inserts we have weren't doing much to keep moisture off our infant's skin, but then we tried these. They are a bit bulky, so we were skipping them for day use and going to just use them for overnight, but I'm glad we tried them. They actually wicked moisture away from his skin rather than just spreading it out over the entire insert like other materials did. MUST HAVE.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Cox

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with Best Bottoms and Alva Cloth Diapers!
customer_reviews.text: If I had five thumbs id give this 5 thumbs up! I only prewashed my inserts once but it lasted 5 hours on my baby before it got soaked up. No leaks. I only changed him because he pooped. I used these inserts on my best bottom dipes. Theyre perfect and the poop washes off easily. I only wished these have snaps so i can snap them on my best bottoms. But it stays in place so theres no problem! And the gussets keep my baby's breastfed poop in! My son is on BB medium setting and the inserts fit like a glove! This is my favorite CD Combination.
customer_reviews.author: RACarlos

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t like at first but have quickly become my favorite!
customer_reviews.text: At first I didn’t like the gussets. They don’t fit inside pocket diapers extremely well because of them. However, I do really like them if placed ON the diaper rather than inside the pocket- the gussets really help contain messes. They also work well in Buttons diaper covers, which is the other kind of diaper we are trialing. As far as absorbancy, they are amazing. They are very similar, if not exactly the same, to the Alva charcoal inserts, which have been my favorite of all the inserts I’ve gotten. I will definitely be purchasing more.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Lokemoen

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: These are very absorbent. Can soak up to 2-3 pees (or maybe more) and didn't cause any leaks. Love it. Bought it along with the 'Baby Double Rows os snaps' cloth diapers and the GroVia bioliners that are flushable. I just flush the bioliner, rinse this cloth diaper liner with warm water, squeeze out the water and throw it in the washer. Perfect replacement to disposable diapers. I still use disposable diapers when we are going out. I use cloth diapers at home.
customer_reviews.author: Ciby Narayanan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use in a medium/large gDiaper
customer_reviews.text: First time cloth diaper mom with a heavy wetter. She gets two of these at night and wakes up dry. Easy to use in a medium/large gDiaper. The only "problem" I've had is they don't play nice with the hook and loop in the dryer, but as long as it's folded over, that's not even a problem. I also wish I had bought more, because I save them for night time use but would love to use them during the day, as well!
customer_reviews.author: Tim B

customer_reviews.title: Urine leaks out
customer_reviews.text: These inserts were great at first, but once I realized the simple prefolds absorb urine faster, I'm sorry I bought these. THey hold a lot of urine and are so easy to clean because you don't have to worry about staining, but I can't use them while my baby is sleeping because the urine leaks right out the back and sides. I wish I had just gone with the prefolds from the beginning. I now use them during awake periods.
customer_reviews.author: N. Marie

customer_reviews.title: Super soft, super absorbent.
customer_reviews.text: I smile everytime i use one on my baby. :) They are super soft, very absorbent, clouds of comfy. When added to his diaper they wick the moisture away from his skin despite holding so much. These are the absolute best to add to your cloth diaper set. Little man very definitely likes his cloth, and he seems to sleep better in them as opposed to paper diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Williams

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: These definitely soak up more pee than the inserts that came with my cloth diapers. I have simple being and mama koala diapers and I prefer to use these inserts. I can get at least another 1/2 hour to an hour before any minor leaks. The other brands I can barely get just 2 hours but these I get 2.5 to 3 hours. Definitely be sure to wash them before use as recommended
customer_reviews.author: k phillips

customer_reviews.title: Huge decline in quality
customer_reviews.text: Quality has declined since I bought these years ago for my first child. I thought these would be a safe bet for a cloth diaper insert but after just prepping to wash, the seams have already started to fall apart and they just look old. The edge wear is extensive after just a few washes so I doubt these will withstand the test of time. It also lowers the resale value for parents who want to flip their diapers for a small profit after they've gotten their use out of them. I wouldn't purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Family CPO

customer_reviews.title: Will dye your other stuff
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t been able to see these fully in action. I’ve washed about 4 times and the absorbency seems ok. What I did not like is that I washed with a couple of my white inserts and all the color came off these and dyed my inserts. NOT COOL. So now I’m apprehensive about using them because I don’t want to have to wash them separately.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Great absorbing inserts!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to give these a try after having lots of leaks with our microfiber inserts. We washed them a few times in hot water before the first use. So far these have been great. We use them in our Econobum, Thirsties and Rumperoos covers and they absorb a ton of urine. No leaks yet, and I've even put them on my heavy wetter son overnight. They are also very soft. I'm very happy with them and will probably be adding more to my stash soon!
customer_reviews.author: Mindy G.

customer_reviews.title: Absorbs great. Wash separate.
customer_reviews.text: These things absorb a TON of liquid. However I don’t have the time to wash them separate than the shells. If you wash them together they ruin the shell because charcoal stains.
customer_reviews.author: CIJIMATT

customer_reviews.title: Like!
customer_reviews.text: I like these however they look a little worn after awhile. I order them twice but just a little disappointed with the threads that started to fray after a few washes. I used them with my Grovia shells. I am full time cloth diapering one baby and these are the main pads I use. They wash up great (just fray a bit) and absorb well. I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Davidson

customer_reviews.title: First time cloth diapering, LOVE THESE!
customer_reviews.text: First time cloth diapering and I LOVE these inserts! They are seriously so absorbent. And I love that they’re a darker color so they don’t really stain. They are perfect for the daytime, and night time! (Although for nighttime I also add another thin insert, just in case lol) we have never had any leaks! No cons so far. Will update if needed!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Bugajski

customer_reviews.title: So soft and absorbent!
customer_reviews.text: We have two orders of these. I love them. They don't stain very easily, the gussets help keep messes in, they don't stink up easily, and they absorb very well! We double stuff one of these with a microfiber at night, and no more leaks :) Prepping these was a pain, but any natural fiber will be. I threw them in with my baby's clothing laundry for three washes, and then used them without incident.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Good for Number 1, NOT good for Number 2
customer_reviews.text: They are very absorbent and do a great job so far with minimal smells. HOWEVER, the cinching in the middle is more cumbersome than helpful if anything. When he poops he blows out each diaper more often than not because the insert tapers in the middle. I would not buy these again, but would get ones that are not tapered in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Chawes

customer_reviews.title: My go to inserts
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely my go to inserts. I am a covers and inserts kind of mom. They are super easy and convenient. But what I like most about them is that they are all natural fibers, very soft, and absorbent. After my daughter wets, it wicks away the moisture and keeps her feeling dry. The double gussets help contain any blow outs. And the grey color doesn't show any stains. I really like these inserts and plan on using then until they virtually fall apart, which I hope is never.
customer_reviews.author: Tinseltapestry

customer_reviews.title: Yes, yes,
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to try with some of our other cloth diapers and I have to say these are AMAZING!! They hardly feel wet when they are which makes for a less fussy baby. He hates wet pants. They are very soft. They have not leaked so far and we were having some leaks with some other kinds. I have already passed this product along to some other moms planning to buy cloth diapers. We love them!!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Can’t hold pee
customer_reviews.text: These suck. I had other insert that were 4 layers and they leaked after an hour so I bought these because the reviews seems super good for a heavy wetter. Well after 2 hours my daughter pees through them, she’s only 10 months. At night I double them and they are fine. I don’t want to always double them or else her booty is super big. I’m super disappointed. I’ve washed them so many times and still suck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and clean up nicely
customer_reviews.text: So I have never bought these before but when my son started to get really bad diaper rash I came straight to amazon to find something soft and absorbent .. I got these amazing inserts which I recommend so hard !! Sometimes my son would wear two and I bought him bug diaper covers so that he could sleep with them
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I really love these I like that they are sinched in the middle, it helps when I am preparing my diapers because it is already in the shape I needed to be in. they also stay in place better! The only thing that could make this better would be to add snaps on them so I could fall down either side
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Sue

customer_reviews.title: Better than the ones that come with diapers but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved these so much I bought a second set because the microfiber ones that come with pocket diapers are a joke. I loved the elastic sinching because it helped with leaks. After I bought the second set however, they seemed to start leaking! Almost every diaper gets pee around the legs. Not sure what happened. Still a better option that the thin micro fibers but they’re not perfect.
customer_reviews.author: mzk26

customer_reviews.title: Seems good so far
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I like the ruffles on the sides because it helps keep stuff in. They do take a while to dry but that is expected with anything that's super absorbent...7 months later still good. I purchased more of these, because I have to double up now that my baby is 8 months old. I use these with best bottom diaper covers. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Yagolfpirate

customer_reviews.title: LOVE ITS ABSORBENCY
customer_reviews.text: I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS BRAND. I WOULD BUY THE OTHER VERSION, THE ONES WITHOUT THE GUSSETS. I OWN ALVA BABY DIAPER COVERS WITHOUT THE POCKET WHICH IT HAS DOUBLE GUSSETS. I ALSO HIGHLY RECOMMEND THOSE. ANYWAYS. THIS VERSION ITS KIND OF HARD TO REMOVE THE POOP SINCE IT REALLE GETS INTO THE GUSSETS. I LOVE HIS ABSERBENCY AND THAT IT DOES NOT CAUSE IRRITATION NOR DIAPER RASH TO MY BABY'S SKIN.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: So thick and bulky that theycauses gaps between babies thighs. Leaks at night so I just thought maybe we had to use disposables at night. I was still so new to cloth so I thought this was normal. Not so! I joined a cloth mama Facebook group and a few recommendations later, I had new inserts, for daytime AND nighttime, new diapers, a better fit, and no leaks ever. These went right in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: ReneeRTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: My go to insert!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite of the inserts I've used so far - I love the gussets and they hold liquid in really well without feeling wet to the touch. The only down fall is due to their awesome absorbency, they're the only ones (of my inserts) that tend to get the ammonia smell going - so I have to do extra rinsing with these, extra drying and I use vinegar in the cold wash to help. Even with this, still my favorite. Not too big, not too small - definitely my go to insert! Just wish they were a little less expensive...
customer_reviews.author: Kel

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive - work well with Alvababy pocket diapers
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my Alvababy pocket diapers, and they work great. More absorbable than the ones that come with the diaper, and they hold their shape better, making it easier to get in the pocket. Soft and fairly absorbable - I have doubts about the charcoal properties, but who cares if they work well?
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Not good for pocket diapers
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I LOVE the flat version of these! But these are not the best at all for pocket diapers. I imagine they might be good with standard covers but they really increase the thickness of my diapers. Very unfortunate purchase. :(
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wettengal

customer_reviews.title: Love! But GUSSETS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would love this instert SO much more if the gussets would stop FRAYING! Its happened on 4/12 so far, and i ordered another 36! I'm using a washer with an agitator and no middle spinning piece, so they dont wven have that excuse! That being said, these are STILL my favorites!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Very absorbent!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of getting these, based on the mixed reviews. But I’m really glad I did. My boy is a heavy wetter and one of these lasts him all night, and I have yet to experience a leak. Before switching to cloth, I was up changing him literally every 1 to 2 hours. Expensive and tiring much?! These are so awesome, I just ordered 2 more 12 packs!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Pretty pleased with these
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these probably a year and a half ago. I think they are great quality, and a very reasonable price! The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because to my surprise I actually do not like the gusset style insert...As our babe got bigger I felt like they were more likely to leak if you didn't get the insert in just so. I definitely prefer the flat inserts, it's more effective to have a double gusset pocket diaper or cover. If you purchase these, remember that the absorbancy with charcoal/bamboo inserts gets even better after 5-10 washes. I prepped them by washing twice prior to use, and that was sufficient for prep.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Kemp

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these! I use them with my Alva pockets, they are fine against my baby's skin. They don't shift which is wonderful! I'll put them in gdiapers as well, and while bulky one is a nice over night option for my 9 week old(she generally wakes once for changing, a super soaker might need a doubler!) Overall I'd recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda King

customer_reviews.title: Still leaks
customer_reviews.text: The absorption is great. However, due to the design of the middle of the insert where it is bunch up, it leaves a little gap between the insert and the edge of the diaper. So many times baby boy pees out of the diaper. I will order the straighter version of these inserts next time.
customer_reviews.author: Dathan

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and absorption
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad i purchased these for our cloth diapers. I only need one of these and we have no leaks. With the inserts that came with our diapers we need to double layer to get that same absorbency. The gusseting probably also help. I think they are great quality and I am buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: When needed, I will get more of these!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! Thick, so I don't have to worry about naptime leakage. They wash well, and don't smell. They are really soft! Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: AmaLeachBeech

customer_reviews.title: I love these. They hold everything in and I only ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these. They hold everything in and I only need to use one for regular daytime use. A must have for cloth diapering. Fast shipping. They seem a little big when first get them but once washed once the end up being perfect size to lay on top diaper or to stuff pocket. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer J. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Absorbent and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for the past 3 months and love them! They work much better than the thin liners that came with the diapers we bought. They pull the moisture away from my son's skin and we have had zero issues with diaper rash.
customer_reviews.author: Kato2k

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for babies 3 months and up!
customer_reviews.text: Super absorbant, fantastic insert considering it's all synthetic materials and synthetic doesn't tend to be great for diapers in my opinion. I first tried these out when my little guy was just a month old and hated them, they are too big for newborns. However, I held on to them and tried again when he was 3 months and they are my favorite insert. My little guys is now 7 months and I'm adding more of these to my stash and high recommend for babies 3 months and up!
customer_reviews.author: Heater Family

customer_reviews.title: Great absorbency & fit
customer_reviews.text: I love that these are double gusseted, darker colors (doesn’t show stains, not that it matters) & very absorbant. I’ve never had a leak & they fit all our different brand pocket covers we have tried them in.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Maybe for bigger babies!
customer_reviews.text: They are very absorbent and easy to clean/dry BUT for my six months old (20lbs) baby they’re too long and bulky! Maybe will be great for bigger babies! I will keep them for later, but yes these aren’t the softest inserts out there🧐
customer_reviews.author: Flower25

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. I almost never write reviews but these are worth it. They are insanely easy to clean even sticky poop off of, they absorb very well and keep my baby much more dry than other inserts. They also keep everything in with the genius leg gussets and don’t stain or show gross discoloration because they are dark. The only drawback is that my baby is quite petite at five months and these are about 2 inches too long so I wish they made them in a shorter length. But that is the only drawback in my opinion! Would absolutely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Edith R. LaPoint

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting - Leaked Everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use with my cloth diapers and they were not absorbent at all. I took great care in prepping them per instructions and they do not hold anything! I've tried them in a few different cloth diapers (Bum genius, Flips, gDiaper, fuzzibuns etc) and every time my little one is completely soaked. I am very disappointed. I was equally disappointed that I could not find a manufacturer contact number/email to talk to someone about troubleshooting (perhaps there is a way to strip them or there is something else I could be trying) I don't know! I just want to be able to use them with my little one.
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: these are freaking awesome ! i use these in conjunction with the mama koala cloth diaper covers and its awesome ! it honestly feels like she didnt wet the diaper when i go to change her. she is 3 weeks and about 9 lbs now.
customer_reviews.author: M.Roberts

customer_reviews.title: So glad i bought
customer_reviews.text: So happy i bought these. I've been having to use two microfiber inserts since my little girl goes through 1. Cloth diapers are already bulky as is but doubling the insert made it so much worse. Now I can just use one of these and it works great for my 1.5year old.
customer_reviews.author: brownie06921

customer_reviews.title: Almost 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 dozen of these to supplement the cotton prefolds I already use. My daughter is 18months and a little taller than average, but these are way too small for her to wear only one at a time. We use flip and econobum covers, and they are open all the way on the biggest setting. But they work great doubled for overnight. She's a very heavy wetter and they didn't leak. They would be nice for daily wear on a younger baby though, until a year or so.
customer_reviews.author: avidreader89

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for cloth diapers. They fit inside pouches and the gusseted legs keep them where they're supposed to be. My 3 month old can go overnight in them. With the cotton inserts she cries when the diaper is wet, these are better at wicking away the moisture. Completely worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: db

customer_reviews.title: Work great and are holding up well
customer_reviews.text: Work great and are holding up well. I've not ever double stuffed with either of my children and these inserts. I use them in pockets and covers. Knocked one star off because it took them FOREVER to lose the chemically smell that some reviewers harp about. As my stash increases, I'll buy another set of these. The gussets seem to help with trimness.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Miracle

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddler diapering
customer_reviews.text: These worked like a charm for my toddler when she started peeing a lot more than when she was a babe. I love the fact that they are made to follow the natural curvature of the diaper. So far charcoal inserts have been the most absorbent option for us! (Note: for my 2 yo I usually triple stuff compared to when I only single stuffed when she was a baby - you'll find the older they get the more stuffing you may have to do, especially overnight)
customer_reviews.author: Christine Giuffrida

customer_reviews.title: Marginally better than plain microfiber.
customer_reviews.text: We bought these hoping to have a good step up from the standard microfiber inserts that come with most pocket diapers. Once our little one started compression leaking out of her microfibers, we stepped up into these and it worked... for a few weeks. The gussetting is a nice added layer, but it doesn't help much if the microfiber layers are compressing through.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie G

customer_reviews.title: The Gussets Are Incredible
customer_reviews.text: So there bamboo inserts - they work. Yay! But the gussets? GAME CHANGER. These are so much easier to stuff, make fit easier - oh and we've NEVER had a blowout or leak with these. EVER. And my son thinks peeing over night is an Olympic Sport he's determined to take gold in. Yup, happy mom.
customer_reviews.author: Amber L

customer_reviews.title: Using in Alvababy diapers
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my Alvababy diapers because the current inserts just weren't doing it any more for my 17 month old heavy wetter. These have been great! Only thing is that when I washed them the first couple times, the gray coloring got onto my white inserts. So that was weird, but they're working very well!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Balsitis

customer_reviews.title: Harder to clean
customer_reviews.text: These are less easy to clean between the folds and elastic sides. They are also harder to fit within the shell as they are longer. I have the most trouble with these over the flat ones and that is consistent over the month of use.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Salvas

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! They are much more absorbent than the white microfiber liners that come with the diapers. We got 1 set of these to use for overnight and they are perfect! My baby can use just 1 diaper for the night. If I put her in a diaper with the regular liner I have to change her in the middle of the night to prevent leaks. They have gotten even more absorbent after several washes.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany W.

customer_reviews.title: I will buy again
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I give 4 stars is because after awhile the inserts start smelling. No matter how I wash, they have an odor to them. Took at least 10 washes to be at the most absorbent, but I was expecting that. But other than that I love them! double up at night and NO accidents!! Plus they have a "slimmer" look than the original diapers I had been using so now she looks more proportionate!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the buy, I like the ones that came with the diaper better. These aren't very flexible so the fit is awkward and i feel like it would be annoying for baby to have this between their legs.
customer_reviews.author: Lara T

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: These worked great as reinforcement on top of my cloth diapers at night for my son! I used them on top of his cloth diaper, because he peed a lot. I loved that I didn't have to worry about stains.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Stockman

customer_reviews.title: Don't use any other liner!
customer_reviews.text: Do not cloth diaper without these liners! They're awesome, hold way more than the microfiber liners, and keep your baby's skin dry. These are way better than using the liners that come with your diaper cover. The gusseted sides also make for a great for no matter your baby's size. I will continue to use these for my baby and any future babies I may have.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good liners
customer_reviews.text: These are good liners, as they seem to soak things up really well. No leaks so far! I'm not sure I'm a fan of the pleating in the middle, it makes it a little harder than just the straight liners, I'm not sure what the point of them is.
customer_reviews.author: katie

customer_reviews.title: these made me love cloth diapering
customer_reviews.text: i cant believe I'm saying this but...these make me love cloth diapering. I am so thankful for this product. The dark color is great for not getting discolored.... esp from the yellow breastfed baby poo. i had an interaction with the customer service and they were phenomenal.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: No leaks!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 month old can go 4 hours during the day between changes with one insert, and 12 hours at night with two! They last longer on him than Luvs or Up and Up disposables! We are using them with Hibaby’s AI2/Hybrid covers. We bought two dozen and one did have some stitching from the center unravel a little during washing, but it does not affect the performance!
customer_reviews.author: Little Crow

customer_reviews.title: Too long, don't fit in pockets on smaller snaps
customer_reviews.text: Too long for 6 month old diaper size. I've used cloth for years. These don't fithink in any of our pockets unless they are adjusted to the largest possible size. Would not recommend unless you are in full sized diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Too LONG
customer_reviews.text: Excessively long. Fits outside of the liner. I purchased this same brand 3yrs ago and they are perfect. This newer iteration/version is a different texture (softer) (I don’t know how that functions) and 25% longer. I had to return it, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: WAM

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Must for Cloth Diapers
customer_reviews.text: I recommend these inserts to ANYONE wanting to use cloth diapers. Thinner than other inserts but much more absorbent! When my son was a baby he would wear one during the day (other liners we could never do less than two) and two at night. Now that he's 18 months he just wears one of these with each diaper. Much less laundry for me and his butt isn't so big as with other liners.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Kleppen

customer_reviews.title: Beyond all expectations
customer_reviews.text: I rarely - no never - give five stars but these are incredible. I don't know where the moisture goes!?! They are SUPER absorbent and barely feel wet. If I could afford it I would replace every pad that I have with these. But for the meantime I will simply use them as baby's overnight pad to keep him from soaking through his diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Diana E. Witherspoon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome purchase!
customer_reviews.text: These are great inserts! They hold more pee than the microfiber inserts that came with the diapers I purchased and they wash and dry great! They also stopped the frequent leaks we were having with the microfiber.
customer_reviews.author: Bre A.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought different kinds of cloth diapers and none of the liners that they came with were are good as these! I highly recommend these inserts, they absorb more than the usual liner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing so far!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because my 20 month old toddler started leaking through her other inserts (purchased over almost 2 years ago)! These hold so much it's amazing! She has all of a sudden become a heavy wetter! And as always I love my gussets!
customer_reviews.author: C53

customer_reviews.title: ... because these inserts are thick and the gussets are cool but I have had a couple leaks out of ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this item 5 stars because these inserts are thick and the gussets are cool but I have had a couple leaks out of them. I'm wondering if its because of the gussets and maybe I should try sticking them on top of the diaper rather than in the pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, washes great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, washes great! I pre washed separately to avoid stains (like others have commented) but didn't seem to notice any! I have been washing them with my diapers and prefolds since the 2nd wash with no issue. The gussets do not seem to get in the way, and help hold the poopies in cover and pocket diapers! Also, no problems on sensitive skin. 4 stars because they could be just a little better quality. I would give 4.5 if I could!
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee

customer_reviews.title: Absorbent
customer_reviews.text: I just started cloth diapering and I love these inserts. The fact that they are scrunched up make it easier to put on the diaper because they already fold perfectly. They are super absorbent and really soft. I will be buying more in the future!
customer_reviews.author: johana

customer_reviews.title: Then I washed them again (after the first) use and they have been working great, ever since
customer_reviews.text: I got these because my baby is a heavy wetter. At 1 year we are still going cloth strong, but I couldn't do the microfiber ones. So I prepped the heck out of these and at first they did ok (better than microfiber but not so much that I was impressed). Then I washed them again (after the first) use and they have been working great, ever since. Few leaks is a bonus. I use them with covers and her bottom isn't any more red or irritated. Side note: I thought I would like the gusset element, but I found out i don't really
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these inserts for a month now. They do exactly what they say. They absorb better. My baby does not get diaper rash. They are super soft and easy to clean. I will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: heather

customer_reviews.title: Repels liquids, constant leaking
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get these to soak up liquid. I read great reviews, but did not get positive results. 100% cotton prefolds and flats used as liners have been much easier and successful to use on my heavy wetter in a shell or Pocket diaper, easier to wash and dry as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Beaumont

customer_reviews.title: No more leaks
customer_reviews.text: Love love love these inserts! They work so well and are very absorbent, I use to use the Gerber prefolds and just a simple cover with my daughter but we kept getting leaks, decided to give these a try and I'm so impressed! No more leaks! They aren't bulky either. Love
customer_reviews.author: Jenae

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I switched to these after the standard white ones were not doing the trick anymore. Urine was never the issue. My son's bowel movements became larger and the white ones could not absorb it all. These handle it well. I love the gathering in the center too. I took a chance with ordering these with the gather and I would not go back.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love!
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is now I only want to use these inserts and will need to order more!😆😆 These have been so great especially for bedtime. If you're considering if you should try these- DO IT!
customer_reviews.author: A.Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best I've tried so far
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best I've tried so far. I use BumGenius AIO and Apple Cheeks Cloth Diapers and have a chunky heavy wetter. These retain the most moisture. I double up on them for overnights and have not had an issue with leaking, except for when I use the Apple Cheeks.. I have to triple up on those but those don't come with any built in inserts.
customer_reviews.author: LivebytheLau

customer_reviews.title: I like the elastic in the middle
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these to upgrade from the standard terry cloth inserts as now my child is a year he is soaks through them so quickly. I like the elastic in the middle, can only presume my kid finds it more comfortable as well comparative to the other charcoal inserts we have. So far, I do like them alot better overall and pleased I upgraded to them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, absorbent, easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these with the flip cover. I am still experimenting with positioning, but so far they are great (I had one small leak, but I think that was on me). They take a little extra drying time in the dryer, and they are thick so they take up a lot of drawer space, but they are soft and really absorbent. They also work well inside a pocket diaper.
customer_reviews.author: MelanieNichole

customer_reviews.title: Is it for cold winter?
customer_reviews.text: Is it for cold winter? Because, in summer it'll be a nightmare for your child. Especially with a poly..smth cover.
customer_reviews.author: Yuri Lavor

customer_reviews.title: Good and soft
customer_reviews.text: I got this specifically as my 1 year old has rashes due to constant diapering. So i changed to cloth diapers and bought this insert due to good reviews. I keep changing the diaper frequently. So far, these bamboo diapers hav not leaked.. I will know the rest after washing them. They are good and soft.
customer_reviews.author: Fasy

customer_reviews.title: Good but issues
customer_reviews.text: These are very soft and I like the gussets on the side which helped prevent leaking. The downfall was that I washed them exactly as directed and three of them have already have seams coming apart or sticking out. The absorbency is good though and my little guy is comfortable with them against his skin.
customer_reviews.author: Christin

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite diaper essential
customer_reviews.text: These are very absorbent and do a great job wicking moisture away from the skin. The gussets also allow them to remain flat when in use rather than get all twisted up. I prefer them over my other bamboo liners any day of the week.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

product_meta.title: Naturally Natures Cloth Diaper Inserts 5 Layer - Insert - Charcoal Bamboo Reusable Diaper Liners with Gussets (Pack of 12)
feature_bullets: PROTECTION WHERE IT COUNTS –These cloth diaper inserts are made from charcoal bamboo which wicks moisture away, keeping your baby dry and comfortable.
5-LAYERS OF ABSORBENCY – Two layers of soft charcoal bamboo fleece surround three ultra- absorbent microfiber layers that trap up to 10 ounces of liquid.
DOUBLE ELASTICIZED GUSSETS – Provide a contoured, snug fit that prevents those messy leaks.

SAVE MONEY – These diaper inserts are reusable and fully machine washable, and become softer and more absorbent the more they are washed. Using cloth diapers with inserts is less expensive than disposable diapers, and reduces landfill waste.

FITS BABIES OF ALL SIZES – These charcoal bamboo inserts measure 13” long by 5” wide and are designed to fit all one-size pocket or cover diapers. The inserts will last from the newborn stage through toddlerhood. UNSURPASSED QUALITY – Made from breathable Bamboo viscose fiber (71.3% bamboo, 28.7% polyester) and double stitched for improved durability.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,021 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
